title: 107_s1210
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE." is a concise statement indicating the beginning of a section with a short title. The Act is named the "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002." It reauthorizes the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996, extending block grants and federal guarantees until 2007. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to extend federal guarantees and training assistance until 2007. The American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to extend provisions until 2007, including the Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund. The American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to extend provisions until 2007, including the Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund. Section 3 defines key terms. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a new section defining "housing related community development" as tribally-owned facilities or infrastructure that support the construction of reservation housing and reduce construction costs for Indian tribes. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to define "housing related community development" as facilities or infrastructure supporting reservation housing construction to reduce costs for Indian tribes. SEC. 4. Amends the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5. Addresses program income and labor standards. Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to require recipients to utilize income for housing related activities in accordance with the Act. Subsection (a)(2) now includes "Restricted Access or" before the word "Reduction" in the heading. The amendment to Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 now requires recipients to use income for housing-related activities. Subsection (a)(2) has been updated to include new requirements regarding the expenditure of retained program income. SEC. 6. REGULATIONS. Section 106(b)(2)(A) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include regulations required under the Act, including any future amendments. Section 601 is also amended to include housing-related community development activities. SEC. 8. FEASIBILITY STUDIES TO IMPROVE THE DELIVERY OF HOUSING ASSISTANCE IN NATIVE COMMUNITIES. Section 202 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a community development demonstration project. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a community development demonstration project for Native communities. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to use funds for community development projects. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a study on a demonstration project for Indian tribes to use funds for community development projects. The Secretary must submit the study to specific Senate and House committees within a year of the Act's enactment. The Secretary is required to conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to receive assistance in a way that enhances tribal authority in Federal housing and related activities. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 authorizes Indian tribes to receive assistance for Federal housing projects with a focus on tribal authority and decision-making. The Secretary is required to conduct a study on the feasibility of this demonstration project and submit the findings to relevant Senate committees. The Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 requires the Secretary to submit a study to relevant Senate and House committees. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must complete a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of this Act and provide recommendations to Congress on addressing the issue.
